post_text:
Tomorrow will mark the 19th anniversary of September 11th. The impact of these attacks were devastating. Around 3,000 lives were lost between plane passengers, those in the buildings that were struck and front-line workers trying to save people. It was the biggest act of terrorism ever in the United States. Patriot Day was proclaimed by President George W. Bush and is recognized every year on September 11th.

On Patriot Day, U.S. flags are lowered halfway and there is a country-wide moment of silence at 8:46am (Eastern Daylight Time), which is when the first plane crashed into one of the Twin Towers. Although the attacks were in the U.S., Patriot Day is recognized worldwide as the news devastated and impacted people all over.

Now more than ever, it would be wonderful to show our patriotism towards our country and unity as the Emmons family. Let's all wear red, white, and blue this Friday!

Raider Rocks!
Hi Raiders! Are you looking for a way to stay connected while we are apart? Do you enjoy getting outside with your family? Join the Emmons Raider Rock hunt!

This started with one of the first graders wanting to surprise his classmates but has turned into a school wide project.
Here's what you do: Raider rocks will be hidden around our houses & neighborhoods. Please feel free to make and hide your own Raider Rock! If you happen to find a "Bob the Raider" rock, don't keep it! Find him a new home so another Raider can enjoy the chance to find it! When you find a Raider Rock, be sure to send picture of yourself with it to Mrs. Heiden via email or via FB messenger for the Emmons page. Wouldn't it be great if every single Raider was able to find one!!!!!

We started with 16 rocks let see how many we can find!

We hope to see you soon!!!

I am hoping to make the decision by 10:00 tomorrow morning. Thank you for your patience. While I appreciate the time and effort the students have put into creating this performance, our main priority is the health of our community.

post_text: Last week, the 5th graders gave persuasive presentations assuming the role of an English colonist living in one of the 13 English colonies. The goal was to persuade incoming colonists to join their colony based on factors such as geography, climate, industries, trade and exports, religion, and raw materials. They also presented a counterargument against one of the other colonies, making sure to point out strong reasons not to live there. Each presentation was followed by a classroom debate in which students were able to voice their rebuttals.

post_text: Emmons Talent Show 2020…Do you like to sing? Dance? Tell jokes? Is it a solo act you’re considering, or some sort of skit or routine with your friends? The 10th annual Emmons Talent Show is scheduled for March 13th and we would love to find out what your hidden talent is! Auditions will take place on Tuesday, January 21st for K-2 and Middle School and Wednesday, January 22nd for grades 3-5. You have plenty of time over Winter Break to think about whether or not you would like to try out! Then, when you return from Winter Break, watch for audition sign-up sheets to be posted throughout the school. Last day to sign up for auditions will be Wednesday, January 15, 2020. Please email Mrs. Jones with any questions at ljones@emmons33.org.

post_text: Mrs. Strom's 5th grade ELA classes launched their new unit on Human Rights by playing detective! Using various pieces of text and video evidence as clues, the Blue Detectives rivaled the Yellow Detectives to try to figure out the theme of their unit. They eventually realized they needed to join forces and share their clues with each other to solve the mystery successfully!
